page.title: 182 WI's OF S.E. BOLDRE
page.content: The area supports 2 Womens Institutes, both long established but with differences closely tied to their locations.S.Baddesley is a small tight knit group who are renowned for their craft work and the high numbers taking part in any event.Their 1st President was Mrs.Whitaker of Pylewell Park,next her daughter the present incumbent. They meet in the Hall <built by the Pylewell Estate> on the 2nd Thursday afternoon each month. They have 35-40 members.Boldre meets in the Memorial Hall on the 1st Thursday evening.Their presidents by tradition serve for 3 years.They have 55-65 members. They are good cooks but only a hard core of 6/7 ever enter a competition,their craft record is excellent.The WI's are "linked" attending the annual AGM in turn.
